title: ICE initializing `impl Fn()` constant with closure

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(impl_trait_in_bindings)] const _: impl Fn() = ||(); ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` 1.45.0-nightly (2020-06-03 56daaf669ebc3d5083db) ``` ### Error output ``` warning: the feature `impl_trait_in_bindings` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> src/lib.rs:1:12 | 1 | #![feature(impl_trait_in_bindings)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default = note: see issue #63065 for more information error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_trait_selection/traits/structural_match.rs:216: unexpected type during structural-match checking: [closure@src/lib.rs:2:22: 2:31] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:907:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.45.0-nightly (56daaf669 2020-06-03) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted error: could not compile `playground`. To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59 4: core::fmt::write at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1076 5: std::io::Write::write_fmt at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1537 6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at
